It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale green to white in color, arranged in clusters. Whitfieldia subviridis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
